title: English language on Turkish server
body:
I've been playing on the Turkish server lately because my latency is just a bit lower there...
But there's a problem. Everything is in Turkish and I can't understand anything.
I tried going to RADS/system/locale.cfg and changing it to en_gb from tr_tr, but it only worked on the patcher. I'm using the beta client and nothing seemed to help change the language there. I even tried going to regions.txt and adding a "|en_US" after the "tr_TR", but nothing happened.
If anyone has a solution to this, I'd appreciate their sharing it with me.

replies.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kuKAWo40jik this guy explains it easy and good

Each region has their own specific set of languages that it supports.  Turkey server currently only supports Turkey, per the [supported languages ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751594-Changing-Game-Language)guide.  

Attempting to modify your game files will likely cause some serious issues with your game, and you'll be likely to crash.  

Instead, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can see if we can help with this latency issue.  We're happy to help!

Well, Riot is not to blame when it comes to this latency issue. In Greece, it's hard to get below 70 ping because the EUNE server is in Frankfurt and it requires a standard amount of time for data to reach. So, when the least amount you can get is 77 in my case, having someone watching HD videos on Youtube or downloading large files while you're playing can ruin the experience.
As I said, Riot can't do anything about this latency issue, as it's a problem on my end.
